Place an order on a particular market. Post a NewStopLimitOrderRequestDTO to the uri specified below.

member.summary: Cancel an order. Post a CancelOrderRequestDTO to the uri specified below
member.param: The cancel order request

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.UpdateOrder(RESTWebServicesDTO.Request.UpdateStopLimitOrderRequestDTO)
member.summary: Update an order (for adding a stop/limit or attaching an OCO relationship). Post an UpdateStopLimitOrderRequestDTO to the uri specified below

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.ListOrders(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Not Implemented.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.ListOpenPositions(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Queries for a specified trading account's trades / open positions.

This uri is intended to be used to support a grid in a UI. One usage pattern is to subscribe to streaming orders, call this for the initial data to display in the grid, and call GetOpenPosition when you get updates on the order stream to get the updated data in this format.
member.param: The trading account to get orders for.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.ListActiveStopLimitOrders(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Queries for a specified trading account's active stop / limit orders.

This uri is intended to be used to support a grid in a UI. One usage pattern is to subscribe to streaming orders, call this for the initial data to display in the grid, and call GetActiveStopLimitOrder when you get updates on the order stream to get the updated data in this format.
member.param: The trading account to get orders for.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.GetActiveStopLimitOrder(System.String)
member.summary:
Queries for a active stop limit order with a specified order id. It will return a null value if the order doesn't exist, or is not an active stop limit order.

This uri is intended to be used to support a grid in a UI. One usage pattern is to subscribe to streaming orders, call ListActiveStopLimitOrders for the initial data to display in the grid, and call this uri when you get updates on the order stream to get the updated data in this format.

For a more comprehensive order response, see GetOrder
member.param: The requested order id.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.GetOpenPosition(System.String)
member.summary:
Queries for a trade / open position with a specified order id. It will return a null value if the order doesn't exist, or is not a trade / open position.

This uri is intended to be used to support a grid in a UI. One usage pattern is to subscribe to streaming orders, call ListOpenPositions for the initial data to display in the grid, and call this uri when you get updates on the order stream to get the updated data in this format.

For a more comprehensive order response, see GetOrder
member.param: The requested order id.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.ListTradeHistory(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Queries for a specified trading account's trade history. The result set will contain orders with a status of (3 - Open, 9 - Closed), and includes orders that were a trade / stop / limit order.

There's currently no corresponding GetTradeHistory (as with ListOpenPositions).
member.param: The trading account to get orders for.
The maximum results to return.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.ListStopLimitOrderHistory(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Queries for a specified trading account's stop / limit order history. The result set will include only orders that were originally stop / limit orders that currently have one of the following statuses (3 - Open, 4 - Cancelled, 5 - Rejected, 9 - Closed, 10 - Red Card)

There's currently no corresponding GetStopLimitOrderHistory (as with ListActiveStopLimitOrders).
member.param: The trading account to get orders for.
the maximum results to return.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IOrderService.GetOrder(System.String)
member.summary:
Queries for an order by a specific order id.

The current implementation only returns active orders (i.e. those with a status of 1 - Pending, 2 - Accepted, 3 - Open, 6 - Suspended, 8 - Yellow Card, 11 - Triggered).
member.param: The requested order id.

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.ITradeService.Trade(RESTWebServicesDTO.Request.NewTradeOrderRequestDTO)
member.summary:
Place a trade on a particular market. Post a NewTradeOrderRequestDTO to the uri specified below.

Do not set any order id fields when requesting a new trade, the platform will generate them.

member.param: The trade request

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IMarketPriceHistoryService.GetPriceBars(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)

summary.p: Get historic price bars in OHLC (open, high, low, close) format, suitable for plotting candlestick charts
Returns price bars in ascending order up to the current time.

When there are no prices per a particular time period, no price bar is returned. Thus, it can appear that the array of price bars has "gaps", i.e. the gap between the datetime of each price bar might not be equal to interval x span

member.param: The marketId
The pricebar interval
The number of each interval per pricebar.
The total number of pricebars to return

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IMarketPriceHistoryService.GetPriceTicks(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get historic price ticks. Returns price ticks in ascending order up to the current time. The length of time between each tick will be different.
member.param: The marketId
The total number of price ticks to return

member.name: M:RESTWebServices.IApiMessagesService.GetSystemLookup(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use the message lookup service to get localised textual names for the various status code & Ids returned by the API. For example, a query for OrderStatusReasons will contain text names for all the possible values of OrderStatusReason in the ApiOrderResponseDTO. You should only request the list once per session (for each entity you're interested in).
member.param: The entity to lookup (eg OrderStatusReason, InstructionStatusReason, OrderApplicability or Culture)
The cultureId used to override the translated text description.
